remarks: A sequence on an upper integer set converges in the real sense iff it converges in the integer sense.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Sep-2014.)
statement:
rlimclim.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
rlimclim.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
rlimclim.3 $e |- ( ph -> F : Z --> CC ) $.
rlimclim $p |- ( ph -> ( F ~~>r A <-> F ~~> A ) ) $.
